About Me

Hi, I’m William Blamey - Americans call me Bill. I am a mathematician who can see the big picture and run big projects.

I am most skilled in understanding business architecture, big piles of inter connected legacy systems and delivering robust functional technology projects. I can code and do detailed business analysis as well.

Career Summary

Front Office delivery focused leader with pragmatic business program/project management.

eTrading, Derivatives Market Risk and Technology expert with excellent business and mathematical knowledge that shows proven problem solving capability.

Extensive career developing and delivering front office derivative risk quantitative technology as a senior hands on technical IT project manager and program manager.

Delivered innovative, best in city, front office risk and eFX Options platforms.

Excellent line and project manager of 20+ developers and support staff.

Made key strategic technology decisions at BAML GFX with a $70m program budget for a business with $950m Revenue, 400 producers, 400 Technologists.

Skilled at setting up governance structures and reporting critical milestones to senior business management.

Solid mathematical skills. Formal programming language proofs. Oxford MA.

Good programming ability. Functional programming in agile style. (20 Years C++, distributed systems, Python)

Exceptional business analysis, derivative product knowledge.

Solid team building and project planning skills. MS Project

Projects

FRTB.IO

github.com/billblamey

Financial service consultancy and cloud based analytic engine specialising in FRTB and LIBOR transition

This is my main startup idea at the moment - it seems that the banks will be holding far more capital after FRTB in 2022 if their models, data and processes are not sorted out. The goal would be to push the SA calculation to one of the big data ecosystems in a standard secure way. Some alteratives are AWS EMR for Hadoop and Spark, Dynamo DB, Glue, Kinesis, Cloudera Data Platform, Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure

FOGU

www.fogu.co.uk

Freelance Financial service consultant specialising in regulatory change and the delivery of that in technology

Main source of income currently, working as a specialised project manager in investment banks.

Implementing a 3rd party FinTech regulatory rules engine into BNPP front office tech stack across all asset classes. Running cross asset delivery across multiple teams and asset class based streams. Project management of multiple teams to deliver ex-post cost and charges reporting. Analysis of cost figures in MS Excel and SQL. 10 million records heuristically analysed and corrected.

Santander

santander.com

Rates IT Partner (Program Manager)

Oct 2015 - Dec 2016

Delivering IT across the entire Fixed Income Stack

As the primary IT interface between the Rates business and the various Santander technology divisions, local and global, the IT partner is responsible for the budgets, planning and delivery for all technology projects. Main areas of focus was running the business as usual RAD project, implementing a robust governance mechanism and delivering a MiFiD compliant Rates E-comm infrastructure (ION/Bloomberg), replacing the front office pricing and risk platform with an in-house model driven solution and upgrading the desk from obsolete risk technology (Murex). In each of these areas I initially assumed the role of project manager, running daily SCRUM calls, working out the immediate priorities with the stakeholders, planning an effective delivery route, tracking against the plan and supplying the PMO the weekly status reports.

Royal Bank Of Scotland

rbs.com

Project Manager, Customer Standards Price Construction Policy

Apr - Oct 2015

Making pricing policy fair and consistent

As part of a radical change in the way that markets operates in RBS, I was responsible for delivering a new pricing policy in RBS Markets and implementing the necessary changes and controls to ensure that pricing is fair and consistent. This was a cross asset class project that touches the core principles of pricing. Daily stakeholder engagement across technology, business management and the change function made this a challenging role relying heavily on my skills as a subject matter expert in pricing and risk.

Chief Operating Officer, Global Quantitative Group

Mar 2012 - Apr 2014

Organising the Quantitative Group

Business plan development for various cross asset (Commodities, Fixed income and currencies, credit, equities, algorithmic trading) technology and quantitative programs for group of 200 quants, including the global planning process and program management of various regulatory projects and the yield curve unification.

In this role in addition to using my extensive technical knowledge, I expanded my knowledge of business accounting, learning enrichment, cross team coordination through town halls and focus groups.

Negotiated successfully various supplier contracts, saving BAML millions

Bank Of America - Merrill Lynch

bofaml.com

Chief Information Officer (CIO), Global Foreign Exchange

May 2010 – Mar 2012

Merging two huge IT infrastructures and pushing the implementation of quartz(python)

Post merger coordinated technology direction for GFX. Coordinated the technology business value add with multiple business heads (Spot, Fwds, Prime brokerage, Options and Sales) across the global organisation and ensure delivery of that mandate by the then fragmented technology organisation.

Major achievements include unification of the main FX cash platform, which 3-5% of the worlds foreign exchange passes through, unification of the FX options platform, helping to build an eFX options platform, setting strategies for the FX Retail systems development, the global support model, the governance of the $70M technology expenditure that supports a business that has direct front office revenues of $950m. The FX Options platform won fx derivatives platform of the year 2012, the business won in 2013. The eFX options platform connected to a number of the then emerging fx options exchanges and I was responsible for this connectivity.

With the FX Settlement and Treasury sales teams I saw and championed a number of opportunities that lead to me being on the pitching teams for various bids with a number of large US corporates, including winning a landmark deal with AMEX. I also was on a number of industry panels to discuss the implementation of clearing and margining.

Merrill Lynch

ml.com

Quant Developer Manager, Quantitative Risk Development and Trading Support, Director

Apr 1996- May 2010

Build a huge compute farm to give exotic derivatives realtime risk

Developed the business strategy, working closely with the business heads, and implement the technology response.

Managed a team of 7 London based quant developers (CFXRisk core development) and 9 offshore production support (CFXRisk production support). Built a team of exceptional strength.

Wrote the user guide at BAML for the main FX exotics risk and pricing platforms. Worked with the test and QA teams at Santander and BAML to develop testing strategies for various project implementations. Sign off (and management of stakeholder sign off)  of main FX risk platforms (BAML). Ensure key stakeholders are informed of production outages, liase with production support for level one response and develop level 2 responses with development teams. (BAML)

Coordinated the integration of models and release cycle for 18 quants.

Advised another team of 9 developers (GFX Technology risk management, market data support and pricing tools).

Responsible for front office risk for the following global businesses derivatives, Complex FX derivatives, Short Dated FX options, GFX STIRT and Vanilla Forwards, LCT FX Option trading and finally Commodity, Equity and FX hybrid business. The revenue from these businesses exceeds 500m.   Delivery of high performance C++ analytic and risk management tools to the traders and marketers. Delivery of risk, P&L, P&L explain and credit numbers to management, regulatory, finance and risk. The technology was mainly Windows GUI front end, with a COM interface to Excel risk management summaries with a UNIX and linux distributed back end. The risk run was for 300 books over a 8600 cpu cluster.

Gained knowledge of many exotic products, having implemented many models myself. Met the large number of internal and external audit and regulatory requirements for these books and records systems.

Initially started as a front office desk quant. Writing C++ MonteCarlo simulations of hedging costs. Wrote the initial PRD model using a trinomial tree. In 1996 with the traders we built an Excel based risk management system.
